verses.verse: ( The Birth and Adoption of Moses) ( 510 7:20-22 ;  650 11:23 ) וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ <WH1980> way·yê·leḵ - אִ֖ישׁ <WH376> ’îš Now a man מִבֵּ֣ית <WH1004> mib·bêṯ of the house לֵוִ֑י <WH3878> lê·wî of Levi וַיִּקַּ֖ח <WH3947> way·yiq·qaḥ married אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- a בַּת־ <WH1323> baṯ- daughter לֵוִֽי׃ <WH3878> lê·wî of Levi,

וַתַּ֥הַר <WH2029> wat·ta·har conceived הָאִשָּׁ֖ה <WH802> hā·’iš·šāh and she וַתֵּ֣לֶד <WH3205> wat·tê·leḏ and gave birth to בֵּ֑ן <WH1121> bên a son. וַתֵּ֤רֶא <WH7200> wat·tê·re When she saw אֹתוֹ֙ <WH853> ’ō·ṯōw - כִּי־ <WH3588> kî- that ט֣וֹב <WH2896> ṭō·wḇ beautiful [child], ה֔וּא <WH1931> hū he [was a] וַֽתִּצְפְּנֵ֖הוּ <WH6845> wat·tiṣ·pə·nê·hū she hid him שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה <WH7969> šə·lō·šāh for three יְרָחִֽים׃ <WH3391> yə·rā·ḥîm months.

וְלֹא־ <WH3808> wə·lō- no יָכְלָ֣ה <WH3201> yā·ḵə·lāh But when she could עוֹד֮ <WH5750> ‘ō·wḏ longer הַצְּפִינוֹ֒ <WH6845> haṣ·ṣə·p̄î·nōw hide him, וַתִּֽקַּֽח־ <WH3947> wat·tiq·qaḥ- she got לוֹ֙ Prep│3ms ( lōw) him תֵּ֣בַת 8392 N-fsc ( tê·ḇaṯ) basket גֹּ֔מֶא 1573 N-ms ( gō·me) a papyrus וַתַּחְמְרָ֥ה 2560 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3fs│3fs ( wat·taḥ·mə·rāh) and coated it בַחֵמָ֖ר 2564 Prep-b, Art│N-ms ( ḇa·ḥê·mār) with tar וּבַזָּ֑פֶת 2203 Conj-w, Prep-b, Art│N-fs ( ū·ḇaz·zā·p̄eṯ) and pitch. וַתָּ֤שֶׂם 7760 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3fs ( wat·tā·śem) Then she placed בָּהּ֙ Prep│3fs ( bāh) in אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) [the basket] הַיֶּ֔לֶד 3206 Art│N-ms ( hay·ye·leḏ) the child וַתָּ֥שֶׂם 7760 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3fs ( wat·tā·śem) and set בַּסּ֖וּף 5488 Prep-b, Art│N-ms ( bas·sūp̄) it among the reeds עַל־ 5921 Prep ( ‘al-) along שְׂפַ֥ת 8193 N-fsc ( śə·p̄aṯ) the bank הַיְאֹֽר׃ 2975 Art│N-proper-fs ( hay·’ōr) of the Nile.

וַתֵּתַצַּ֥ב <WH3320> wat·tê·ṯaṣ·ṣaḇ stood אֲחֹת֖וֹ <WH269> ’ă·ḥō·ṯōw And his sister מֵרָחֹ֑ק <WH7350> mê·rā·ḥōq at a distance לְדֵעָ֕ה <WH3045> lə·ḏê·‘āh to see מַה־ <WH4100> mah- what יֵּעָשֶׂ֖ה <WH6213> yê·‘ā·śeh would happen לֽוֹ׃ Prep│3ms ( lōw) to him.

וַתֵּ֤רֶד <WH3381> wat·tê·reḏ went down בַּת־ <WH1323> baṯ- Soon the daughter פַּרְעֹה֙ <WH6547> par·‘ōh of Pharaoh לִרְחֹ֣ץ <WH7364> lir·ḥōṣ to bathe עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- in הַיְאֹ֔ר <WH2975> hay·’ōr the Nile, וְנַעֲרֹתֶ֥יהָ <WH5291> wə·na·‘ă·rō·ṯe·hā and her attendants הֹלְכֹ֖ת <WH1980> hō·lə·ḵōṯ were walking עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- along יַ֣ד <WH3027> yaḏ the riverbank הַיְאֹ֑ר <WH2975> hay·’ōr .... וַתֵּ֤רֶא <WH7200> wat·tê·re And when she saw אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַתֵּבָה֙ <WH8392> hat·tê·ḇāh the basket בְּת֣וֹךְ <WH8432> bə·ṯō·wḵ among הַסּ֔וּף <WH5488> has·sūp̄ the reeds, וַתִּשְׁלַ֥ח <WH7971> wat·tiš·laḥ she sent אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - אֲמָתָ֖הּ <WH519> ’ă·mā·ṯāh her maidservant וַתִּקָּחֶֽהָ <WH3947> wat·tiq·qå̄·ḥɛ·hå̄ to retrieve it.

וַתִּפְתַּח֙ <WH6605> wat·tip̄·taḥ When she opened it, וַתִּרְאֵ֣הוּ <WH7200> wat·tir·’ê·hū she saw אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַיֶּ֔לֶד <WH3206> hay·ye·leḏ the child, וְהִנֵּה־ <WH2009> wə·hin·nêh- and behold, נַ֖עַר <WH5288> na·‘ar the little boy בֹּכֶ֑ה <WH1058> bō·ḵeh was crying. וַתַּחְמֹ֣ל <WH2550> wat·taḥ·mōl So she had compassion עָלָ֔יו <WH5921> ‘ā·lāw on him וַתֹּ֕אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer and said, מִיַּלְדֵ֥י <WH3206> mî·yal·ḏê children. ” הָֽעִבְרִ֖ים <WH5680> hā·‘iḇ·rîm the Hebrew זֶֽה׃ <WH2088> zeh “ This is one of

וַתֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer said אֲחֹתוֹ֮ <WH269> ’ă·ḥō·ṯōw Then his sister אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to בַּת־ <WH1323> baṯ- daughter, פַּרְעֹה֒ <WH6547> par·‘ōh Pharaoh’s הַאֵלֵ֗ךְ <WH1980> ha·’ê·lêḵ “ Shall I go וְקָרָ֤אתִי <WH7121> wə·qā·rā·ṯî and call לָךְ֙ Prep│2fs ( lāḵ) אִשָּׁ֣ה 802 N-fs ( ’iš·šāh) women מֵינֶ֔קֶת 3243 V-Hifil-Prtcpl-fs ( mê·ne·qeṯ) מִ֖ן 4480 Prep ( min) one of הָעִבְרִיֹּ֑ת 5680 Art│N-proper-fp ( hā·‘iḇ·rî·yōṯ) the Hebrew וְתֵינִ֥ק 3243 Conj-w│V-Hifil-ConjImperf-3fs ( wə·ṯê·niq) to nurse לָ֖ךְ Prep│2fs ( lāḵ) for you? ” אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) - הַיָּֽלֶד׃ 3206 Art│N-ms ( hay·yā·leḏ) the child

וַתֹּֽאמֶר־ <WH559> wat·tō·mer- told לָ֥הּ Prep│3fs ( lāh) her. בַּת־ 1323 N-fsc ( baṯ-) daughter פַּרְעֹ֖ה 6547 N-proper-ms ( par·‘ōh) Pharaoh’s לֵ֑כִי 1980 V-Qal-Imp-fs ( lê·ḵî) “ Go ahead, ” וַתֵּ֙לֶךְ֙ 1980 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3fs ( wat·tê·leḵ) went הָֽעַלְמָ֔ה 5959 Art│N-fs ( hā·‘al·māh) And the girl וַתִּקְרָ֖א 7121 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3fs ( wat·tiq·rā) and called אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) - אֵ֥ם 517 N-fsc ( ’êm) mother. הַיָּֽלֶד׃ 3206 Art│N-ms ( hay·yā·leḏ) the boy’s

וַתֹּ֧אמֶר <WH559> wat·tō·mer said לָ֣הּ Prep│3fs ( lāh) to her, בַּת־ 1323 N-fsc ( baṯ-) daughter פַּרְעֹ֗ה 6547 N-proper-ms ( par·‘ōh) Pharaoh’s הֵילִ֜יכִי 1980 V-Hifil-Imp-fs ( hê·lî·ḵî) “ Take אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) - הַיֶּ֤לֶד 3206 Art│N-ms ( hay·ye·leḏ) child הַזֶּה֙ 2088 Art│Pro-ms ( haz·zeh) this וְהֵינִקִ֣הוּ 3243 Conj-w│V-Hifil-Imp-fs│3ms ( wə·hê·ni·qi·hū) and nurse him לִ֔י Prep│1cs ( lî) for me, וַאֲנִ֖י 589 Conj-w│Pro-1cs ( wa·’ă·nî) and I אֶתֵּ֣ן 5414 V-Qal-Imperf-1cs ( ’et·tên) will pay אֶת־ 853 DirObjM ( ’eṯ-) - שְׂכָרֵ֑ךְ 7939 N-msc│2fs ( śə·ḵā·rêḵ) your wages. ” וַתִּקַּ֧ח 3947 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3fs ( wat·tiq·qaḥ) took הָאִשָּׁ֛ה 802 Art│N-fs ( hā·’iš·šāh) So the woman הַיֶּ֖לֶד 3206 Art│N-ms ( hay·ye·leḏ) the boy וַתְּנִיקֵֽהוּ׃ 5134 Conj-w│V-Hifil-ConsecImperf-3fs│3ms ( wat·tə·nî·qê·hū) and nursed him.

וַיִגְדַּ֣ל <WH1431> wa·yiḡ·dal had grown older, הַיֶּ֗לֶד <WH3206> hay·ye·leḏ When the child וַתְּבִאֵ֙הוּ֙ <WH935> wat·tə·ḇi·’ê·hū she brought him לְבַת־ <WH1323> lə·ḇaṯ- daughter, פַּרְעֹ֔ה <WH6547> par·‘ōh to Pharaoh’s וַֽיְהִי־ <WH1961> way·hî- and he became לָ֖הּ Prep│3fs ( lāh) her לְבֵ֑ן 1121 Prep-l│N-ms ( lə·ḇên) son. וַתִּקְרָ֤א 7121 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3fs ( wat·tiq·rā) She named him שְׁמוֹ֙ 8034 N-msc│3ms ( šə·mōw) ... מֹשֶׁ֔ה 4872 N-proper-ms ( mō·šeh) Moses וַתֹּ֕אמֶר 559 Conj-w│V-Qal-ConsecImperf-3fs ( wat·tō·mer) and explained כִּ֥י 3588 Conj ( kî) ..., מִן־ 4480 Prep ( min-) of הַמַּ֖יִם 4325 Art│N-mp ( ham·ma·yim) the water. ” מְשִׁיתִֽהוּ׃ 4871 V-Qal-Perf-1cs│3ms ( mə·šî·ṯi·hū) “ I drew him out

( The Rejection and Flight of Moses) ( 510 7:23-29 ) וַיְהִ֣י׀ <WH1961> way·hî - בַּיָּמִ֣ים <WH3117> bay·yā·mîm One day הָהֵ֗ם <WH1992> hā·hêm ..., וַיִּגְדַּ֤ל <WH1431> way·yiḡ·dal had grown up, מֹשֶׁה֙ <WH4872> mō·šeh after Moses וַיֵּצֵ֣א <WH3318> way·yê·ṣê he went out אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to אֶחָ֔יו <WH251> ’e·ḥāw his own people ( Or his brothers) וַיַּ֖רְא <WH7200> way·yar and observed בְּסִבְלֹתָ֑ם <WH5450> bə·siḇ·lō·ṯām their hard labor. וַיַּרְא֙ <WH7200> way·yar He saw אִ֣ישׁ <WH376> ’îš ... מִצְרִ֔י <WH4713> miṣ·rî an Egyptian מַכֶּ֥ה <WH5221> mak·keh beating אִישׁ־ <WH376> ’îš- ... עִבְרִ֖י <WH5680> ‘iḇ·rî a Hebrew, מֵאֶחָֽיו׃ <WH251> mê·’e·ḥāw one of his own people.

וַיִּ֤פֶן <WH6437> way·yi·p̄en After looking כֹּה֙ <WH3541> kōh this way וָכֹ֔ה <WH3541> wā·ḵōh [and] that וַיַּ֖רְא <WH7200> way·yar and seeing כִּ֣י <WH3588> kî ... אֵ֣ין <WH369> ’ên no אִ֑ישׁ <WH376> ’îš one, וַיַּךְ֙ <WH5221> way·yaḵ he struck down אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַמִּצְרִ֔י <WH4713> ham·miṣ·rî the Egyptian וַֽיִּטְמְנֵ֖הוּ <WH2934> way·yiṭ·mə·nê·hū and hid his body בַּחֽוֹל׃ <WH2344> ba·ḥō·wl in the sand.

וַיֵּצֵא֙ <WH3318> way·yê·ṣê [Moses] went out בַּיּ֣וֹם <WH3117> bay·yō·wm day הַשֵּׁנִ֔י <WH8145> haš·šê·nî The next וְהִנֵּ֛ה <WH2009> wə·hin·nêh and saw שְׁנֵֽי־ <WH8147> šə·nê- two אֲנָשִׁ֥ים <WH582> ’ă·nā·šîm ... עִבְרִ֖ים <WH5680> ‘iḇ·rîm Hebrews נִצִּ֑ים <WH5327> niṣ·ṣîm fighting. וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ <WH559> way·yō·mer He asked לָֽרָשָׁ֔ע <WH7563> lā·rā·šā‘ the one in the wrong, לָ֥מָּה <WH4100> lām·māh “ Why תַכֶּ֖ה <WH5221> ṯak·keh are you attacking רֵעֶֽךָ׃ <WH7453> rê·‘e·ḵā your companion? ”

וַ֠יֹּאמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer But the man replied, מִ֣י <WH4310> mî “ Who שָֽׂמְךָ֞ <WH7760> śā·mə·ḵā made לְאִ֨ישׁ <WH376> lə·’îš you שַׂ֤ר <WH8269> śar ruler וְשֹׁפֵט֙ <WH8199> wə·šō·p̄êṭ and judge עָלֵ֔ינוּ <WH5921> ‘ā·lê·nū over us? ( Cited in and ) הַלְהָרְגֵ֙נִי֙ <WH2026> hal·hā·rə·ḡê·nî to kill me אַתָּ֣ה <WH859> ’at·tāh Are you אֹמֵ֔ר <WH559> ’ō·mêr planning כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר <WH834> ka·’ă·šer as הָרַ֖גְתָּ <WH2026> hā·raḡ·tā you killed אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַמִּצְרִ֑י <WH4713> ham·miṣ·rî the Egyptian? ” ( LXX Are you planning to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday? Cited in ) וַיִּירָ֤א <WH3372> way·yî·rā was afraid מֹשֶׁה֙ <WH4872> mō·šeh Then Moses וַיֹּאמַ֔ר <WH559> way·yō·mar and thought, אָכֵ֖ן <WH403> ’ā·ḵên has surely נוֹדַ֥ע <WH3045> nō·w·ḏa‘ become known. ” הַדָּבָֽר׃ <WH1697> had·dā·ḇār “ This thing I have done

וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע <WH8085> way·yiš·ma‘ heard פַּרְעֹה֙ <WH6547> par·‘ōh When Pharaoh אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הַדָּבָ֣ר <WH1697> had·dā·ḇār - הַזֶּ֔ה <WH2088> haz·zeh about this matter, וַיְבַקֵּ֖שׁ <WH1245> way·ḇaq·qêš he sought לַהֲרֹ֣ג <WH2026> la·hă·rōḡ to kill אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - מֹשֶׁ֑ה <WH4872> mō·šeh Moses. וַיִּבְרַ֤ח <WH1272> way·yiḇ·raḥ fled מֹשֶׁה֙ <WH4872> mō·šeh But Moses מִפְּנֵ֣י <WH6440> mip·pə·nê from פַרְעֹ֔ה <WH6547> p̄ar·‘ōh Pharaoh וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב <WH3427> way·yê·šeḇ and settled בְּאֶֽרֶץ־ <WH776> bə·’e·reṣ- in the land מִדְיָ֖ן <WH4080> miḏ·yān of Midian, וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב <WH3427> way·yê·šeḇ where he sat down עַֽל־ <WH5921> ‘al- beside הַבְּאֵֽר׃ <WH875> hab·bə·’êr a well.

וּלְכֹהֵ֥ן <WH3548> ū·lə·ḵō·hên Now the priest מִדְיָ֖ן <WH4080> miḏ·yān of Midian שֶׁ֣בַע <WH7651> še·ḇa‘ had seven בָּנ֑וֹת <WH1323> bā·nō·wṯ daughters, וַתָּבֹ֣אנָה <WH935> wat·tā·ḇō·nāh and they came וַתִּדְלֶ֗נָה <WH1802> wat·tiḏ·le·nāh to draw water וַתְּמַלֶּ֙אנָה֙ <WH4390> wat·tə·mal·le·nāh and fill אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הָ֣רְהָטִ֔ים <WH7298> hā·rə·hā·ṭîm the troughs לְהַשְׁק֖וֹת <WH8248> lə·haš·qō·wṯ to water צֹ֥אן <WH6629> ṣōn flock. אֲבִיהֶֽן׃ <WH1> ’ă·ḇî·hen their father’s
